intro: Aglaomorpha quercifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf aglaomorpha, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that resemble those of an oak tree. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
